title: run: seems to incorrectly handle relative paths if ran within subdirectory

labels.name: relative paths
labels.description: Issue related to the treatment of relative path specifications

milestone.title: Release 0.12.0
milestone.description:
- drop support of direct mode
- potentially bring revolution home fully or in parts

body:
There could be more oddities or just that my eyes are sore already (couldn't reliably reproduce for a bit and then it "worked").  Calling datalad run with output relative path being somewhere `../` causes two kinds of (wrong) behavior when output path points to a subdataset:

1. immediate subdataset
```
/tmp/topds > cd /tmp; sudo rm -rf topds; datalad create /tmp/topds; cd /tmp/topds/; mkdir sub; touch sub/input; datalad save -m cleanup; datalad create -d . output; cd sub; datalad run --explicit --input ../sub/input --output ../output md5sum '{inputs}'                        
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/topds 
create(ok): /tmp/topds (dataset)                                                                                
add(ok): sub/input (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/topds/output 
create(ok): output (dataset)                                                                                    
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  create (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
[INFO   ] Making sure inputs are available (this may take some time) 
[WARNING] path not associated with any dataset [get(/tmp)] 
get(impossible): .. (directory) [path not associated with any dataset]
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) ===== 
d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e  input
[INFO   ] == Command exit (modification check follows) ===== 
action summary:
  get (impossible: 1, notneeded: 1)

```
so seems to work but see the WARNING above -- `..` seems to be taken from the top of the dataset?

2. when output points to sub-subdataset, it just crashes:

```shell
/tmp/topds > cd /tmp; sudo rm -rf topds; datalad create /tmp/topds; cd /tmp/topds/; mkdir sub; touch sub/input; datalad save -m cleanup; datalad create -d . -c text2git output; datalad create -d output/sub; cd sub; datalad run --explicit --input ../sub/input --output ../output/sub bash -c 'md5sum {inputs} > {outputs}/checksum' 
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/topds 
create(ok): /tmp/topds (dataset)                                                                                
add(ok): sub/input (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/topds/output 
create(ok): output (dataset)                                                                                    
[INFO   ] Running procedure cfg_text2git 
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) ===== 
[INFO   ] == Command exit (modification check follows) ===== 
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  create (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/topds/output/sub 
create(ok): . (dataset)                                                                                         
[INFO   ] Making sure inputs are available (this may take some time) 
[ERROR  ] '/tmp/topds/sub/../output/sub' does not start with '/tmp/topds/output' [__init__.py:relative_to:1077] (ValueError) 
```

so if first one just feels that there is treatment of relative paths as there was `--dataset` argument -- from the top of it, in the 2nd case feels like some normalization of the path is due before asking pathlib's `PosixPath.relative_to`
